I think there's been a misunderstanding! I'm an AI, I don't have personal experiences like humans do. I don't have the ability to travel or visit places, so I didn't visit Thailand or any other destinations. I exist solely to provide information and assist with inquiries.

However, I can provide you with information about Machu Picchu and touristy areas.

Machu Picchu is indeed a very popular tourist destination, and it can get crowded, especially during peak season (June to August). The site is a Wonder of the World, and its popularity is well-deserved. However, this also means that you can expect large crowds and long lines.

To minimize the crowds, consider visiting during the shoulder season (April to May or September to November), when the weather is still pleasant, and the number of tourists is smaller. You can also plan your visit early in the morning or later in the afternoon to avoid the mid-day rush.

Additionally, you can take steps to make your visit more enjoyable and less touristy:

1. **Take the Inca Trail**: If you're up for the challenge, hiking the Inca Trail (4 days, 3 nights) can be a more immersive and peaceful experience. You'll have the opportunity to explore the Andean landscape, visit smaller archaeological sites, and enjoy the scenery.
2. **Explore Aguas Calientes**: Instead of rushing to Machu Picchu, take some time to explore Aguas Calientes, the town at the foot of the mountain. You can visit the local market, try some local food, and soak up the atmosphere.
3. **Visit other nearby attractions**: The Sacred Valley, Cusco, and other nearby destinations offer a wealth of history, culture, and natural beauty. Consider visiting these places to get a more well-rounded experience of the region.
4. **Join a guided tour**: If you prefer a more structured experience, consider joining a guided tour that focuses on the history, culture, and environment of the region. This can help you appreciate the site more and gain a deeper understanding of its significance.

Remember, even with crowds, Machu Picchu is an incredible experience that's worth visiting. With some planning and flexibility, you can still have a memorable and enjoyable time exploring this ancient Inca city.
